trans-unit.source: Automated Patching for SQL Server in Azure Virtual Machines
trans-unit.target: Automated Patching for SQL Server in Azure Virtual Machines

trans-unit.source: Explains the Automated Patching feature for SQL Server Virtual Machines running in Azure.
trans-unit.target: Explains the Automated Patching feature for SQL Server Virtual Machines running in Azure.

trans-unit.source: Automated Patching for SQL Server in Azure Virtual Machines
trans-unit.target: Automated Patching for SQL Server in Azure Virtual Machines

trans-unit.source: Automated Patching establishes a maintenance window for an Azure Virtual Machine running SQL Server 2012 or 2014.
trans-unit.target: Automated Patching establishes a maintenance window for an Azure Virtual Machine running SQL Server 2012 or 2014.

trans-unit.source: Automated Updates can only be installed during this maintenance window.
trans-unit.target: Automated Updates can only be installed during this maintenance window.

trans-unit.source: For SQL Server, this ensures that system updates and any associated restarts occur at the best possible time for the database.
trans-unit.target: For SQL Server, this ensures that system updates and any associated restarts occur at the best possible time for the database.

trans-unit.source: It depends on the SQL Server IaaS Agent.
trans-unit.target: It depends on the SQL Server IaaS Agent.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Automated Patching relies on the SQL Server IaaS Agent.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Automated Patching relies on the SQL Server IaaS Agent.

trans-unit.source: To install and configure the agent, you must have the Azure VM Agent running on the target virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: To install and configure the agent, you must have the Azure VM Agent running on the target virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Newer virtual machine gallery images have this option enabled by default, but the Azure VM Agent might be missing on existing VMs.
trans-unit.target: Newer virtual machine gallery images have this option enabled by default, but the Azure VM Agent might be missing on existing VMs.

trans-unit.source: If you are using your own VM image, you will also need to install the SQL Server IaaS Agent.
trans-unit.target: If you are using your own VM image, you will also need to install the SQL Server IaaS Agent.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [VM Agent and Extensions](http://azure.microsoft.com/blog/2014/04/15/vm-agent-and-extensions-part-2/).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [VM Agent and Extensions](http://azure.microsoft.com/blog/2014/04/15/vm-agent-and-extensions-part-2/).

trans-unit.source: Configure Automated Patching in the Portal
trans-unit.target: Configure Automated Patching in the Portal

trans-unit.source: You can use the [Azure Preview Portal](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=525040&clcid=0x409) to configure Automated Patching when you create a new SQL Server Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: You can use the [Azure Preview Portal](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=525040&clcid=0x409) to configure Automated Patching when you create a new SQL Server Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: The following screenshot shows these options under **OPTIONAL CONFIGURATION** | **SQL AUTOMATED PATCHING**.
trans-unit.target: The following screenshot shows these options under **OPTIONAL CONFIGURATION** | **SQL AUTOMATED PATCHING**.

trans-unit.source: SQL Automatic Patching in Azure Portal
trans-unit.target: SQL Automatic Patching in Azure Portal

trans-unit.source: For existing SQL Server 2012 or 2014 virtual machines, select the **Auto patching** settings in the **Configuration** section of the virtual machine properties.
trans-unit.target: For existing SQL Server 2012 or 2014 virtual machines, select the **Auto patching** settings in the **Configuration** section of the virtual machine properties.

trans-unit.source: In the **Automated patching** window, you can enable the feature, set the maintenance schedule and start hour, and choose the maintenance window duration.
trans-unit.target: In the **Automated patching** window, you can enable the feature, set the maintenance schedule and start hour, and choose the maintenance window duration.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] When you enable Automated Patching for the first time, Azure configures the SQL Server IaaS Agent in the background.
